name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Boston-Cambridge

reviews.text: I was here at end of March with my daughter for her to check out Harvard and attend the Admitted Student Open House. We stayed 3 nights and it was overall an enjoyable stay. The property is well kept. The rooms are nice and clean.
reviews.title: Nice property, just a bit remote...

reviews.text: The one issue I have is the location of the Hotel is a bit of an inconvenience if you don't have a car. Since we were there to visit Harvard and the property's website said it was "adjacent to Harvard", we thought we could just walk there, so we didn't get a rental car. The Hotel is very close to Harvard MBA school and some housing. However, the main campus and buildings were a good 30 minutes (brisk) walk away across the river. The Hotel is not that close to any T station neither. The closest one is a good 15-20 minutes away. OK if the weather is good, but not sure how that would be if in the snow. The Hotel does offer complementary shuttle to major attractions close by, including Harvard Square, but they're infrequent and the schedule didn't work that well for us.
reviews.title: A Superb hotel

reviews.text: Overall, it is a great property and we enjoyed it very much, but if I were to come back to visit my daughter, I will opt for a property close to a T station and take the T directly to Harvard Square.
reviews.title: Nice Property, Comfort, Good value and Great Location!

reviews.text: Rented 8 rooms for a family vacation. And was very impressed with this hotel. Upon arrival was offered hot cookies for all my guest. And from desk staff made sure to save us room all next to each other. And were extremely helpful throughout stay and really treated us the way a hotel guest should feel.They gave my 18 month old daughter a doll with chocolate on checkout. Rooms are great two rooms one is a bedroom which was clean and comfortable and other is a living room which was spacious with a countertop for food. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Can't wait to go back. Thanks you Doubletree Boston staff.
reviews.title: Boston with the kids

reviews.text: A very nice suite type hotel where you get all you need for business purposes or if you want to be near Harvard University.
reviews.title: Just what I needed

reviews.text: You just can't beat the price and service of the Double Tree Suites of Boston. Actually I consider it Cambridge since it's on the west bank of the Charles River, but whatever. The staff is more than friendly and helpful. They even rescheduled a flight for us on a very last minute delay by our original airline. The maid service just kept asking what else we needed or would like to have. I think we had enough extra blankets and pillow for another suite.
reviews.title: Chillin' on the Charles

reviews.text: The view is the thing. Be sure and ask for a room about six or eight floors up with your suite's bedroom window facing the Charles River. Watching sunrise over the city of Boston, Harvard and Boston College rowing teams out for their early practice....just priceless!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: They provided shuttle service to all the main points of interest in downtown Boston with a schedule throughout the day for picking you up and taking you on to some other spot and eventually back to Double Tree. You get a badge to wear they can see easily when a guest is waiting for them on the corner. Not a shuttle? Great taxi service...always ready at the door.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.text: Great jazz club, bar, food....you've got it all at Double Tree Boston.
reviews.title: Sweet suite with a river view!

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Doubletree (formally an Embassy Suites I believe) several times over the years, and they definitely seem to be going through a period of needed improvements. Work is on-going in the lobby, but the rest of the hotel seemed pretty quiet and pleasant. We were upgraded to a river-side suite on the 15th floor which was fantastic - wonderful views and very comfortable. My daughter slept on the pull-out couch which was the most comfortable I've seen - none of those horrible springs and very firm for a change! We had the continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was very good - all freshly prepared food and decent variety. The only other on-property amenity we took advantage of was the hot tub (huge - could have held a dozen people and not felt crowded) and the pool. Both were very nice if dated. Great place to stay in Boston, and the suites make it a great deal.
reviews.title: A suite with a view

reviews.text: A walm welcome from staff and a fresh cookie for all. 3 miles from the city centre but a great view across the Charles river to the city beyond. A free and regular shuttle bus takes you in to the city in a few minutes. An excellent breakfast overlooking the river. A very comfortable suite with a room for the children and one for the parents, I would reccomend this hotel for visiting families who need a two room suite and a good breakfast or evening meal. All in all excellent value and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic for families

reviews.text: For the price of $189/night.....you cannot beat it. Each room is a suite with a separate living area and bedroom area and for that reason alone, I'd stay here again. The bathroom had mildew in the corner of the tub which was gross (Room #722). They should be more aware of that. Their complimentary chocolate chips cookies are too die for. The gym is lacking. No free weights, so bring your own if you care as much as I do. It's a very comfortable hotel overall and if you are with kids, on a budget, or just want to NOT stay in the center of Boston, I'd stay here. It's not far at all from any of the attractions, and you get gorgeous views of the Charles River from your bed!
reviews.title: Great hotel - HORRIBLE BUFFET BREAKFAST!!!

reviews.text: One STRONG warning - DO NOT HAVE THE BUFFET BREAKFAST. IT IS SO DISAPPOINTING AND MADE ME SICK!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel from the 13th to the 18th of August. Check in was nice and easy and the cookies we were handed sent my son into raptures of delight. We were pleasently suprised by the size of the rooms and out of the bedroom window we and a lovely view of the Charles River. My son loved the flat panel tv in the lounge.
reviews.title: Do Not Trust the Hotel Shuttle
Kids loved it...
reviews.text: I was tired when we got to the hotel and pulled back the sheets so I could have a lie down. I noticed one of the sheets had a stain on so I called housekeeping. They immediatly sent someone up to change the bed. I then recieved a call from Kalika who was the housekeeping manager. He asked if everything was now ok and offered us a free movie for our inconvienience. He also got our 2 nights parking fee waived. A little later we had a small box of chocolates also delivered to our room with a note of appology.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel over a long weekend with our 2 year toddler. They were excellent and family friendly. Check in was easy and quick. Parking system was easy in and out. Hotel is nice and clean with cool decor. Our room was awesome, perfect for what we were looking for. Our toddler was able to go to bed in the bedroom and my husband and I were able to hang out in the living room and enjoy our evening. Had no issues at all, would definitely go and stay there again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Friendly Hotel!

reviews.text: Recent stay at the Doubletree was very good. I arrived at 830pm and was checked in quickly; bellman took all our luggage and we parked two cars. We were in our rooms in ten minutes. The room was totally ready and nothing was amiss.
reviews.title: Quality Team

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to dinner at the hotel lounge and ordered immediately. After 35 minutes dinner had not arrived.The waiter was totally apologetic and explained the kitchen was swamped due to a jazz performance in the main room. Oh yeah this hotel has a reknown jass lunge so check it out. In any event the meals came and were very good. When the check was requested the witer siad dinner was on the house as we had to wait so long. How often does this happen? The hotel took it upon themselves to set things right. Totally impressed.
reviews.title: Great Stay and Great Jazz!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing to note is the hotel charges $35 dollars to park overnight in their garage. With two cars I thought this was an unneeded revenue source.
reviews.title: Just we needed

reviews.text: My wife and I decided to take a spur of the moment trip to Boston and we found that this Double Tree was more than suiting for our getaway. Even though it is outside the center of Boston's downtown it was a short drive to downtown or the action near Harvard's Campus with shopping and Cafes alike. This was the best of both worlds. The Scullers Jazz Club was excellent we saw Rufus Reid and friends. Great TIME!!
reviews.title: Great Stay in Boston

reviews.text: It was my first time booking with Expedia. My experience at the hotel was awful. The hotel was noisey and after contacting the front desk 3 times, they could not control the party next door. When I checked out they could not offer me anything because I had booked with Expedia???? If I had booked direct they would have offered me a credit of some sort. Does that make sense?
reviews.title: Doubletree in Boston, booked by Expedia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No more Doubletree, no more Expedia!
reviews.title: Not a good visit

reviews.text: Nice room, but loud - slamming doors and kids running up and down the halls - sounded like my house! No book in the room to describe the in-hotel, restaurants, club other amenities. Couldn't even google anything. When we went to the front desk to ask questions, the girl was very busy and even more rude, it was very embarrassing because there were other people around. I would think an out of the way hotel would work harder to please guests. Rooms were really expensive, not sure why. Probably just a bad week, but we won't stay at any doubletree again based on this experience.
reviews.title: Review - Yes and No
Quiet rooms; "Ouch" Parking Cost!
reviews.text: Beautiful view of the Charles outside our bedroom window!

We arrived at this hotel to know there is paid (35$) parking and it is FULL .Well finally found a space .The entrance to the lobby was closed caz of some construction and there was no front desk available . We waited and finally started searching .Got one employee who just asked name and gave me keys . Didn't even bother to greet or gave any information about the area. Agree - Cookies were hot .Also ,there was a surpise fire drill for 30 mins . We waited outside in cold . I would avoid the hotel in my next trip.
reviews.title: Weekend Warmer With a Jackhammer.

reviews.text: My family really enjoyed this hotel, we had never stayed at the hilton double tree, but we would again! Although the lobby was being renovated, the temporary lobby area was put together well. You did have to walk around through the parking lot from the garage to get in the lobby but that was not a big issue for our family. the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: Double Tree Hilton

reviews.text: The hotel is under renovations so it can be quite noisy during the day if you are working from your room. Be sure to ask not to have a room above the lounge and reception areas....we are hanging out here in Room 303 at 11pm with loud rap music pumping below us. The front desk confirmed that this would go on until 1am and did offer to move us but it was late when we got back and were not thrilled about packing and moving and would have appreciated the notice prior.
reviews.title: Great location but noisy

reviews.text: Great location if you can figure out how to get into property from roads. Short trip over the bridge to Harvard Square. I find it hard to believe at this day and time hilton properties are charging for internet. Beware major construction of lobby extremely loud throughout the day although on the site it states the renovation shouldn't be an issue it is. Wonderful views of the Charles River & Boston skyline.
reviews.title: Suite on the river.

reviews.text: I lived in the Boston area for years and in the recent years, when I have gone back, I have tried a number of hotels all around Boston and Cambridge and I still come back to this one! The price is right, I love the larger rooms and the view of The Charles River and the Boston skyline is well worth it. Excellent service and clean rooms. The only drawback is that the hotel is a slight walk from Harvard Square or Central Square, the two closest subway stations. However, there are generally taxis available outside and I think there is also a hotel shuttle bus to Harvard Square.
reviews.title: Probably my favorite Boston/Cambridge Hotel

reviews.text: This is a very nice suite hotel, located about 10 minutes dirve from downtown boston. If you want to be in downtown and take the T or walk to stuff this is not the place.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel but not in the city

reviews.text: I called beforehand regarding the shuttle service. I wanted to save $ in the hotel budget but not having my savings taken up by taxis. The concierge was very knowledgeable and what he said ended up being true! That was great. I think his name is Malik==something like that. Everything was superb==just like a **** star Hilton.
reviews.title: Loved the Doubletree!

likes.liked: — Quality very high==everyone had smiles on their faces.
likes.disliked: — Location, but they made up for that with the free shuttle service.

reviews.text: We arrived early on a Saturday afternoon. The front desk said there weren't any available rooms so we'd have to wait for one to be made up. I was fine with that because we were early. An hour or so later they checked us into a room on the 3rd floor. The room was fine--it was a suite, but both rooms were rather small and the living area is dark because the only window opens up into the hallway.
reviews.title: Noisy hotel

reviews.text: I could live with the small size, but around 8 or 9 pm our walls started shaking. After a little investigatioh, I discovered the cause--the jazz club was directly below our room. Having two small kids, I was worried they would be woken up. So, I went to front desk and told them the problem. They said , yes the jazz club is right below and that is the problem. No apology. I asked them what they could do about it, because we weren't staying in that room. They got us another room on a higher floor, which solved the jazz club noise. Just our luck, our new neighbors was a family with ~8 people staying in the suite. They kept us up half the night. Can't blame the hotel too much for this, though I'm guessing 8 people is more than the room is supposed to hold.
reviews.title: An excellent choice!

likes.disliked: — Crossing a very busy street to walk into Cambridge

reviews.text: When I asked for another room the next day, they weren't particularly apologetic. Overall, I was disappointed with the attitude at the front desk. They were friendly, but not not particularly compassionate and didn't go out of their way to make our stay nicer than it could have been.
reviews.title: Pluses outweigh minuses

reviews.text: The hotel is fine, but I would never stay here on a Saturday night unless I were sure that I had a room on a top floor. The atrium set up allows all the noise from the club to filter up to higher floors and the staff was not particularly helpful in finding us more appropriate accomodations.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Great, friendly hotel. Fantastic sized suites and really good amenities in the room.
reviews.title: Good base for exploring Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the shuttle bus it made our trip much, much easier
reviews.title: Fine hotel - service is so so

reviews.text: This is our second stay at this hotel. Overall, this is a fine place. The jazz club is excellent and we were able to go to see Ramsey Lewis this past weekend. The show was fantastic and everyone who works at the club are excellent. This time I was smart and booked a king room. During the last visit, I asked for 2 beds and unfortunately, that meant 2 twin beds which were too small and uncomfortable. If you are travelling with 2 and don't want to share a bed, this hotel is not for you. We ate dinner one night with our extended family of 9 in the restaurant and the food was good. The service wasn't up to par and dirty dishes were left on our table after new food had been brought out. This caused a very crowded table. Also, our server didn't stop back to see if we needed/wanted anything else until we were almost done eating. That being said, the food was good. Another evening we stopped at the bar to have a drink and there was no one in it to wait on us. When she finally returned after 5 mins or so, she didn't even acknowledge us and started folding silverware in napkins rather than seeing if anyone wanted to order. Eventually we got her attention and drinks which were fine.
reviews.title: Vacation in Boston

reviews.text: Now as to delivering hilton honors benefits, they do offer the basic continental breakfast included in room rates. If you want the hot items, $6.00 extra charge. I booked a king suite and that is exactly what I was given. No upgrade although the clerk said a river view is an upgrade. I asked for a larger corner room or one of the loft suites, but was told no. Same thing during my last visit 4 months ago. The housekeeping staff are excellent and also so happy to give you extra water or peanuts and the rooms are definitely well cleaned. The shuttle is nice and has friendly drivers.
reviews.title: Business trip
Your reservation is never secured, never
reviews.text: I stayed here during July, 2011. I had stayed at other hotels in Boston downtown but the first time at this hotel. While our stay was comfortable and affordable (good location), I would not stay here again due to the fact the pool you use is at the YMCA (closed on Sundays). This was disappointing. We were issued breakfast for two coupons which was a nice touch (breakfast buffet will run you approximately $15 each). I would look to other hotels to stay downtown Boston. We took the communitor train to Salem for $10 each. I would actually stay outside Boston and just take the train into the city to spend the day. Highly recommend Fajita & Ritas! :))))
Initially, I was confused. I had booked another hotel that was rated about the same- I realized that this hotel was actually a lot closer to Cambridge, but it is categorized as a Boston Hotel.
reviews.title: A Cambridge Hotel

reviews.text: Let me be very clear, if you are looking for a great, spacious hotel close to Cambridge without paying $400-500 a night. This is it! From reading the reviews- you should know about the shuttle and the double tree brand. The shuttle vans were new, comfortable, and On Time! Only change I would suggest is it to have more availability in the evening, but you can easily pick up a cab. Of course great rooms, comfortable space, and great breakfasts, much better than the hampton inn's. Best choice for the area. Lastly, the front desk manager, Yesly was outstanding! . Multi talented in many areas. it was quiet a relief to get that kind of service compared to our last hotel.
reviews.title: Great staff....rally responsive to our requests.

reviews.text: Overall great stay. The staff was really nice and quickly responded to our requests. The only down side was the room would not cool down. We were given a fan which did help. Wouldn't recommmend the breakfast buffet....really expensive.
reviews.title: Great hotel - I stay here whenever I have business in Cambridge
Harvard @ Doorstep
reviews.text: I travel to Cambridge, MA quite often for work and have always stayed at this hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful! They also have warm chocolate cookies upon check in which are delicious!
The staff is very nice. I had to cancel my first night's stay due to a canceled flight and they did not charge me for the first night.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Doubletree while attending a show at Scullers Jazz Club... our room was upgraded to a bi-level suite on the top floor (HHonors Gold member) - awesome two story room with a full living room, fantastic view of the river and a king bed in the loft area.
reviews.title: Retro vibe, very cool touches in room

reviews.text: The shower had 5 shower heads - 1 traditional, 1 handheld and 3 that came out of the wall and could be angled - awesome! In addition the mirror in the bathroom had a tv built in behind the glass - something I had never seen in a hotel before. Very cool feature !
reviews.title: Beautiful property, great location, terrible experience.

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was decent, typical for a Hilton property. Parking was in the attached lot and $35.00 for the night.
reviews.title: Comfortable. Spacious. Clean. Relatively convenient.

reviews.text: The onlly downside was that we weren't there long enough to fully enjoy the room or the other amenities at the hotel. Definitely would return and highly recommend it if you are attending a show or in the local area.
reviews.title: Doubletree in Cambridge: great location, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was gorgeous, easy to find - right before Storrow Drive with amazing views of the Charles. However, upon arriving at 1PM for a wedding, we were well prepared to wait until 3PM (check-in) for our room. We sat in Fusion lounge - overpriced and typical, poor hotel food, until our room was supposed to be ready. We went down to the lobby at 3PM to find out that our room wasn't ready - and wouldn't be for another 30 minutes (or so we were told). It wasn't ready until 430PM! With a wedding in a couple hours, it was not a pleasant experience. The rooms were spacious, with a separate bedroom adjacent to the living room with "pull-out" sofa. The sofa did not pull out - it was broken and we tried for about 30 minutes until giving up and squeezing 2 people on the couch overnight. The TV in the main bedroom did not work. When checking out, we had 3 rooms all together. My parents room service was on our bill and our room service was on my sister's bill. Made for more of a headache during check out after minimal sleep on the couch. Although I highly recommend the property itself - I hope everyone else has less of a hassle than we did. I normally stay at Sheraton's and this was actually my first time at a Hilton, and was rather disappointed by our quality of stay.
reviews.title: Dinner, Show and Stay Package--a great experience

reviews.text: This property was much nicer than I had expected. We were in town the weekend of the marathon and rates in other Boston hotels were astronomical. A Sweet Dreams rate of $189 for our family of 4 seemed downright cheap in comparison. It included a great breakfast buffet for 2 adults and our 11 year old son--our 13 year old daughter was considered an adult for purposes of breakfast, although kids under 18 stay free with parents. Parking was another $20 and, if we wanted wireless, we would have had to pay another $10 per day. However there are computers in the 2nd floor lobby where we could access the internet and that met our needs.
reviews.title: Good family hotel but a bit isolated

likes.liked: — The view of the Charles River

reviews.text: The bedroom was large and had a comfortable bed, desk, TV/amoire and a phenomenal view of the Charles river (we were in a corner unit on the 11th floor). The sitting room had a sofa bed (not so great) and room for a rollaway (nice one--$10 night) so it was perfect for our kids. They were excited about the plasma screen TV, but it was on the wall in an odd place given the furniture layout. There was some wear and tear obvious and some older looking fixtures, but anything that could be easily updated had been done (furnishings, linens, etc...).
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Nice Staff

reviews.text: The concierge service varied a great deal; however, William was very helpful. The concierge arranged the shuttle service which we utilized each day because even with a car, we only drove when necessary (such as to the conference I was attending). It took 10-15 minutes to Copley Square and 30+ minutes to the Aquarium--through heavy city traffic. Though technically in the city of Boston, the hotel is much closer to downtown Cambridge than to any of the interesting parts of Boston and on a nice day, it would be a lovely walk to Harvard Square (about a mile). The shuttle also goes to Harvard Square. We didn't mind the location because we had stayed down in the heart of Boston the week before and felt less compelled to stay downtown. Harvard Square is a very interesting area with lots of restaurants and pubs and the Coop--Harvard's great bookstore.
reviews.title: Great room size but the location...
Amazing Doubletree!
reviews.text: All in all, a good family hotel in a beautiful, but somewhat distant location for a visit to Boston.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here weekend of April 12-15, 2007. We arrived around 2:00 p.m. and the hotel's restaurants were closed, but we used room service and the food and service were very good. It was a busy marathon weekend. The hotel was crowded, but the staff handled everything well. It is a large hotel, but there are four elevators, so waiting for one was never a problem Our room was cleaned in a timely manner every day. Without asking for a view, we were assigned a beautiful, spacious room overlooking the Charles River where we watched rowing teams from colleges all over the country competing. Our weekend activities centered around Boston University, so it was a great location for us. We were, however, unable to use the hotel shuttle because it leaves for specific destinations on a schedule that never coincided with our needs, and it does not take you to other miscellaneous destinations. We spent a lot of money on taxis since the weekend weather was rainy and cold. There is a Whole Foods and a drugstore within walking distance, but a taxi will be needed for other outings if you don't have your car. I would stay here again depending upon the purpose of my visit to Boston. It was a very enjoyable hotel experience.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Rates, 'Expensive' Location
Nice place but parking is a ripoff
reviews.text: This hotel was not as nice as the Hyatt down the way a bit but still a premium spot. Parking is overpriced as ever and unlike the Hyatt, there didn't seem to be a close alternative. But the beds are comfy, its usually available for well under $80 on priceline, and they do have a nice breakfast buffet that is about $15 i believe. Solid accomodations for Cambridge (but the Hyatt is vastly superior if you have the choice).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to Boston from Providence late at night. Hotel is located south of Boston so that was very convenient for us. Location far away from the city, but we didn't mind, because we had our car. What I looked for was clean and spacious room which this hotel offered. Bathroom was also nice and clean.
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.text: They had internet access for a fee, which was nice. Also reading other reviews we didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but bought sandwiches at the Au bon pain, which is right in the hotel. That was a good choice.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at. I had nothing but good experiences with the hotel, my room, and the staff. I was on the 9th floor with a great view of the river. Hands down, if I had a car with me, this would be my hotel of choice in Boston. Problem was, I had no car.
reviews.title: Good hotel!

likes.liked: — Jazz club, river views, free shuttle to town

reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Priceline, which I will hesitate to do in the future. This hotel is not in Cambridge, but in Allston, MA. It is a solid 15 minute walk from the nearest T stop (Central), or $7 cab ride. Its a $20 cab ride to downtown. This added up to a significant expense over my trip, and a lot of wasted travel time getting where I wanted to go. Yes, there is a shuttle and the drivers are super nice, but it doesn't run continuously or late.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again!

likes.disliked: — Gift shop wasn't a gift shop

aka: Doubletree Suites By Hilton - Boston Hotel
